content.description: Sit start at a left hand pinch and a right hand crimp slightly higher.  using the only good and non friable hold on the overhang - figure out how to levitate (or double clutch) your way out of the steep to the top out holds.
content.location: below the V3 bat hang listed in this section. the sit start puts you between two flat rocks as low as you can start on the boulder to the left of the porcupine cave.

content.description: traversing route that spans the whole climbable section of the boulder to the right of the porcupine cave.  start matched on a severely sloping shelf.  pop up to a solid crimp - match, and then make your way left to the arete and then up the arete to the top out holds.
content.location: on the boulder to the right of porcupine cave with an obvious chalked sloping start hold

content.description: Sit start the bottom left of the overhang. Traverse the overhang right to the good ledge. Heel hook and move up the face on good holds. Continue to top out on an easy slab.
content.protection: A couple of crash pads and someone to move them.
content.location: Sit start on good hand holds on the far left of the overhang.

content.description: Start the climb in a bat hang and from there work your way up and to the right. Some really nice movement here and the start is fun. Of course, if you’re feeling strong you could just campus the star but where’s the fun in that? As of right now the top out still needs some cleaning but as of right now the route ends just short of the top out
content.location: The route starts with both hands on the jug.[[]]

content.description: This is a town forestry that has a system of trails throughout Londonderry and Litchfield. There is one main boulder, Porcupine Rock, and several smaller boulders dotting the trails. The rock needs some brushing and TLC but there is potential for some rad projects here.
